page.title: 05 Saint Andrew's Church
page.content: One of the pillars is 951 years old and part of the original church. The present church is 758 years old. There is a pulpit where the priest speaks and a lectern for bible readings. The font is still used for baptisms and you will find it next to the round pillar in the North aisle. There is a service each Sunday (at 11.00). The priest in charge is Rev. Prof Frend and he wears a black coat under a white surplice with a university hood around his neck. Coming into church he follows the choir into their places. Amy and Lizzy are in the choir. There is a ladies choir and a mens choir. Under the East window is the altar with a white cloth and two candles on it. Princess Alice goes every week. I some times go to church.
